intro: Pantlingia celebica, commonly known as the Celebes pantlingia, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
